title: The Black Mask

renewed-issues.note: Issue numbering per FictionMags and logical issue order.  CCE registration and renewal records say that the June 1932 issue was volume 10, number 9.

renewed-contributions.title: The Glass Key
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in CCE renewal record.  FictionMags gives the title of Hammett's contribution to this issue as 'The Glass Key: The Hat Trick', first in a monthly series of stories with titles headed 'The Glass Key'.

renewed-contributions.title: The Glass Key
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in CCE renewal record.  FictionMags gives the title of Hammett's contribution to this issue as 'The Glass Key: The Cyclone Shot', second in a monthly series of stories with titles headed 'The Glass Key'.

renewed-contributions.title: The Glass Key
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in CCE renewal record.  FictionMags gives the title of Hammett's contribution to this issue as 'The Glass Key: Dagger Point', third in a monthly series of stories with titles headed 'The Glass Key'.

renewed-contributions.title: The Glass Key
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in CCE renewal record.  FictionMags gives the title of Hammett's contribution to this issue as 'The Glass Key: The Shattered Key', fourth in a monthly series of stories with titles headed 'The Glass Key'.

renewed-contributions.title: Big Shot
renewed-contributions.note: CCE renewal record says this appeared in the June 1930 issue, but the original issue registration ID and copyright date indicate the July 1930 issue, as does FictionMags's entry for this story.

renewed-contributions.title: Ten Men From Chicago
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given on issue cover. CCE renewal record gives title as 'The Men From Chicago'.

renewed-contributions.title: Shakedown
renewed-contributions.note: Title as given in CCE renewal record. FictionMags gives title as 'Shake-Down'.

renewed-contributions.title: It's the Live Ones That Talk
After Dinner Story
renewed-contributions.note: Magazine cover credits Woolrich; copyright renewal credits Irish. The same author used both names.

renewed-contributions.title: The Silent Witness
renewed-contributions.note: Author is Frederick Faust writing under a pseudonym.

renewed-contributions.title: Guillotine
renewed-contributions.note: Magazine cover credits Woolrich; copyright renewal credits Irish. The same author used both names. Issue per CCE renewal record, but FictionMags does not list a story with the title 'Guillotine' in this issue.

renewed-contributions.title: Collared
renewed-contributions.note: Magazine cover credits Woolrich; copyright renewal credits Irish. The same author used both names.

renewed-contributions.title: Dog Eat Dog
renewed-contributions.note: A 1968 renewal for Reeves's 1940 book 'No Love Lost' mentions that it was previously published serially in Black Mask from September through November 1940.  That renewal might cover this serialization, the only Reeves story in those issues mentioned in FictionMags.

renewed-contributions.title: Dog Eat Dog
renewed-contributions.note: A 1968 renewal for Reeves's 1940 book 'No Love Lost' mentions that it was previously published serially in Black Mask from September through November 1940.  That renewal might cover this serialization, the only Reeves story in those issues mentioned in FictionMags.

renewed-contributions.title: Dog Eat Dog
renewed-contributions.note: A 1968 renewal for Reeves's 1940 book 'No Love Lost' mentions that it was previously published serially in Black Mask from September through November 1940.  That renewal might cover this serialization, the only Reeves story in those issues mentioned in FictionMags.

renewed-contributions.title: The Phantom Crook
renewed-contributions.note: Title per CCE renewal record. FictionMags lists the title of the Gardner story in this issue as 'The Chinese People'. We have not examined the issue in question beyond the cover, which shows a title in Chinese characters.

renewed-contributions.title: Dormant Account
renewed-contributions.note: Magazine cover credits Woolrich; copyright renewal credits Irish. The same author used both names.

renewed-contributions.title: It's So Peaceful in the Country
Manhattan Horse Opera
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record also notes added title 'Head I win, Tails You Lose'.

renewed-contributions.title: The Case of the Carved Model
The Dear and the Dead
renewed-contributions.note: Issue as stated in CCE renewal record.  We did not, however, find any contribution with this title or author in the September 1949 issue, and do not know where else it might have appeared.

additional-notes: A 1979 renewal for The Bloody Bokhara by William Campbell Gault notes that it was published in the November 1948 issue of Black Mask.  The copyright claim, however, appears to be for a revised version published in 1951 or 1952, and the renewal would be too late to cover the earlier 1948 publication.

Some 1950s issues of this magazine included reprints whose copyrights might still be active.  Examples include the January 1951 issue, which includes the copyright-renewed 1933 story 'The Green Widow', and the July 1951 issue, which includes a story reprinted from the copyright-renewed May 1941 issue. The FictionMags contents listings include information about reprints.
